channel.title: Yep.. Another Noob Asking For Help
channel.description:
:eek: Yea I know, im just another noob.. but.. i am looking for some help, (Im only a noob to Private-RS Servers.)
YEARS ago i use to play the old-school runescape, then i just the other month went to see the runescape everyone plays now. and im very interested in running a RS-Server, our community has a dedicated Windows-Server with 4Cores/6Gigs Ram, we are running a tibia server right now, and a few half-life servers. and we feel we have enough room to expand.
ive spent about two hours now searching the forums, understanding how this setup works. and i think i have a fair grasp.. what were not looking for is normal game-play for the community. so anything most like the "real" runescape. we also want people to be able to play via website - WebClient not having to download the software..
ive found a few "cool" looking setups, but some are dated as back as 2006.. were hoping for something that is rather "new" or something that doesnt contain a lot of bugs, or just half coded.
[b]if anyone has a suggestion on which server type to pick.. please let me know![/b]

[/quote]

ah thanks, sorry yea i missed that one.
and thats 317?[/quote]Yes, it is.

item.title: Yep.. Another Noob Asking For Help
item.dc:creator: @1337_owns 1337 owns
item.description:
@1337_owns wrote:

http://uppit.com/URSIU4, but it was said in my other post, not sure if you noticed.

Also, if you want you could use shard
http://shardrev.grahamedgecombe.com/std-initial.rar

Originally Posted by Graham
Ahaha found the problem.

Comment out the openWelcomeScreen() line and it seems to work fine!

Thanks for reporting it Twone, and thanks all for the comments .

EDIT:

Found another problem, to fix it find:

if(client.playerEquipment[i] <= -1) continue;

in the combat manager,
under it add:

if(i == 6 || i == 8 || i == 11 || i == 13) continue;

Originally Posted by Graham
Okay Zezarak found a bug:

To fix it in CombatManager replace:

Code:
client.playerEquipment[i] = -1;
client.playerEquipmentN[i] = 1;With:

Code:
client.getOutStream().createFrame(34);
client.getOutStream().writeWord(6);
client.getOutStream().writeWord(1688);
client.getOutStream().writeByte(i);
client.getOutStream().writeWord(0);
client.getOutStream().writeByte(0);
client.flushOutStream();
client.playerEquipment[i] = -1;
client.playerEquipmentN[i] = 1;

And finally yet another bug:

Quote:
Above:

if (lowMemoryVersion == 1) {
c.lowMemoryVersion = true;
} else {
c.lowMemoryVersion = false;
}

In IOClient

Add:

if(BanProcessor.checkMuted(c.getPlayerName())) {
c.setMuted(true);
}
if(BanProcessor.checkYellMuted(c.getPlayerName())) {
c.setYellMuted(true);
}

Read full topic
item.source: Yep.. Another Noob Asking For Help

item.title: Yep.. Another Noob Asking For Help
item.dc:creator: @TheJMan TheJMan
item.description:
@TheJMan wrote:

do you guys have any links? of the most updated ones you mentioned? by any chance

Read full topic
item.source: Yep.. Another Noob Asking For Help

item.title: Yep.. Another Noob Asking For Help
item.dc:creator: @superwiz789 superwiz789
item.description:
@superwiz789 wrote:

[code]508s are new graphics.

317s are old graphics.

317s are easier to program

508s usualy have more features

317s you can add newer items without modifying the cache.

508s you have to hardcode them in.

317s 90 percent of the time have basic features in, walking, talking idle log out renderning trading friends\ignores etc.

In all honesty, 317>508[/code]

I Agree.

317 FOR LIKE <3

Read full topic
item.source: Yep.. Another Noob Asking For Help

item.title: Yep.. Another Noob Asking For Help
item.dc:creator: @1337_owns 1337 owns
item.description:
@1337_owns wrote:

508s are new graphics.

317s are old graphics.

317s are easier to program

508s usualy have more features

317s you can add newer items without modifying the cache.

508s you have to hardcode them in.

317s 90 percent of the time have basic features in, walking, talking idle log out rendering trading friends\ignores etc.

In all honesty, 317>508

Oh also, if you’re up for a challenge use 474.

And for a base to use on a 317, i would either use delta or event manager emulous for starting, since emulous is well organized and easy to use.

Link for event manager emulous:http://uppit.com/URSIU4

Read full topic
item.source: Yep.. Another Noob Asking For Help

item.title: Yep.. Another Noob Asking For Help
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“TheJMan, post:3, topic:271366”][quote author=jc22493 link=topic=358109.msg2734721#msg2734721 date=1238978105]
317’s are preferred over 508’s. It also depends; do you want a server with all features included? Or do you actually want to put effort into your server?
[/quote]

we would prefer to have everything “included” from the start… friends list / skills / weapons / map.
but im a programmer so the community co-owner is also, so we would be very adamant about modifying it and changing things around, but to start i think a fully functional shell would be best

edit: what’s the difference between 317 and 508?[/quote]
Delta.

Read full topic
item.source: Yep.. Another Noob Asking For Help

item.title: Yep.. Another Noob Asking For Help
item.dc:creator: @superwiz789 superwiz789
item.description:
@superwiz789 wrote:

317’s are MUCH easier to code then 508’s. But 508’s have Rs graphics and are hard to code. Also there are 525’s. These have d claws, vesta’s, and statius’s armor/weapons (Also hard to code)

For 317, i recommend Phonescape source (if you want a all-mopar source) or chassyscape if you want a more updated server. For 508 i recommend jagex-pk. And last but not least for 525’s i recommend jc-scape source.

Happy coding!

Read full topic
item.source: Yep.. Another Noob Asking For Help
